com.turn.ttorrent.client

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.turn.ttorrent.client.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Piece>

    public class Piece
extends Object
implements Comparable<Piece>
    A torrent piece.

    This class represents a torrent piece. Torrents are made of pieces, which are in turn made of blocks that are exchanged using the peer protocol. The piece length is defined at the torrent level, but the last piece that makes the torrent might be smaller.

    If the torrent has multiple files, pieces can spread across file boundaries. The TorrentByteStorage abstracts this problem to give Piece objects the impression of a contiguous, linear byte storage.

    Author:
    mpetazzoni

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(TorrentByteStorage bucket,
             int index,
             long offset,
             long length,
             byte[] hash,
             boolean seeder)
        Initialize a new piece in the byte bucket.
        Parameters:
        bucket - The underlying byte storage bucket.
        index - This piece index in the torrent.
        offset - This piece offset, in bytes, in the storage.
        length - This piece length, in bytes.
        hash - This piece 20-byte SHA1 hash sum.
        seeder - Whether we're seeding this torrent or not (disables piece validation).

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Tells whether this piece's data is valid or not.

        public int getIndex()
        Returns the index of this piece in the torrent.

      • size

        public long size()
        Returns the size, in bytes, of this piece.

        All pieces, except the last one, are expected to have the same size.

      • available

        public void seenAt(SharingPeer peer)
        Mark this piece as being seen at the given peer.
        Parameters:
        peer - The sharing peer this piece has been seen available at.

      • noLongerAt

        public void noLongerAt(SharingPeer peer)
        Mark this piece as no longer being available at the given peer.
        Parameters:
        peer - The sharing peer from which the piece is no longer available.

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
                 throws IOException
        Validates this piece.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this piece, as stored in the underlying byte storage, is valid, i.e. its SHA1 sum matches the one from the torrent meta-info.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        public ByteBuffer read(long offset,
                       int length)
                throws IllegalArgumentException,
                       IllegalStateException,
                       IOException
        Read a piece block from the underlying byte storage.

        This is the public method for reading this piece's data, and it will only succeed if the piece is complete and valid on disk, thus ensuring any data that comes out of this function is valid piece data we can send to other peers.

        Parameters:
        offset - Offset inside this piece where to start reading.
        length - Number of bytes to read from the piece.
        Returns:
        A byte buffer containing the piece data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If offset + length goes over the piece boundary.
        IllegalStateException - If the piece is not valid when attempting to read it.
        IOException - If the read can't be completed (I/O error, or EOF reached, which can happen if the piece is not complete).

      • record

        public void record(ByteBuffer block,
                   int offset)
            throws IOException
        Record the given block at the given offset in this piece.

        Note: this has synchronized access to the underlying byte storage.

        Parameters:
        block - The ByteBuffer containing the block data.
        offset - The block offset in this piece.
        Throws:
        IOException

        Piece comparison function for ordering pieces based on their availability.
        Specified by:
